bibliographic-data.invention-title: DEVICE FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PATIENTS WHO UNDERGO PEG OPERATION, METHOD FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PATIENTS WHO UNDERGO PEG OPERATION AND COMPUTER READABLE MEDIUM

nplcit.text: Wermker, K. et al. "Prediction model for early percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) in head and neck cancer treatment." Oral Oncology 48 (2012) pp. 355-360
Hull, M.A., et al. "Audit of outcome of long-term enteral nutrition by percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy." The Lancet; Apr 3, 1993; Vol. 341, pp. 869-872
Rabeneck, Linda, et al. "Ethically justified, clinically comprehensive guidelines for percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy tube placement." The Lancet; Feb 15, 1997; Vol. 349, pp. 496-498

abstract.p: The present invention provides a device for predicting prognosis of a patient who undergoes PEG, which allows a doctor to obtain predictive results sufficient to judge whether or not to perform the PEG (percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy) for the patient. This device includes: a prognosis prediction expression storage section 14 configured to store a prognosis prediction expression, the prognosis prediction expression being calculated by applying prediction input factors and prediction output factors about a first patient who already underwent the PEG, to ANN (artificial neural network)
and a processing section 16 configured to: receive diagnosis input factors about a second patient, for judging whether or not to perform the PEG on the second patient
calculate diagnosis output factors in response to the diagnosis input factors based on the prognosis prediction expression
and output the calculated diagnosis output factors.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DEVICE FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PATIENT WHO UNDERGO PEG-OPERATION, METHOD FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PATIENTS WHO UNDERGO PEG OPERATION AND COMPUTER READABLE MEDIUM
DISPOSITIF POUR PREDIRE UN PRONOSTIC DE PATIENT POUR UNE OPERATION DE PEG, PROCEDE POUR PREDIRE UN PRONOSTIC D'UN PATIENT POUR UNE OPERATION DE PEG, ET SUPPORT D'ENREGISTREMENT D'ORDINATEUR

abstract.p: The present invention provides a device for predicting prognosis of a patient who undergoes PEG, which allows a doctor to obtain predictive results sufficient to judge whether or not to perform the PEG (percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy) for the patient. This device includes: a prognosis prediction expression storage section 14 that stores a prognosis prediction expression, the prognosis prediction expression being calculated by applying prediction input factors and prediction output factors about a first patient who already underwent the PEG, to ANN (artificial neural network)

and a processing section 16 that inputs diagnosis input factors about a second patient, for judging whether or not to perform the PEG on the second patient, calculates diagnosis output factors in response to the diagnosis input factors by referring to the prognosis prediction expression stored in the prognosis prediction expression storage section and then outputs the calculated diagnosis output factors.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: APPARATUS, METHOD AND PROGRAM FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PATIENT TREATED WITH PEG

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an apparatus for predicting the prognosis of a patient treated with PEG (percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy) which provides a sufficient prediction result sufficient for a medical doctor to judge whether it is right or not to perform treatment of PEG to the patient. SOLUTION: The apparatus includes: a prognosis prediction formula storage part 14 which stores prognosis prediction formula calculated by applying a prediction input factor and a prediction output factor relating to a first patient treated with PEG to an ANN (artificial neural network)

and a processing part 16 which inputs a diagnostic input factor relating to a second patient for determining whether it is right or not to perform treatment of PEG to a second patient, calculates a diagnostic output factor according to the diagnostic input factor by referring to the prognosis prediction formula stored in the prognosis prediction formula storage part 14, and outputs the calculated diagnostic output factor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DEVICE FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PEG-OPERATED PATIENT, METHOD FOR PREDICTING PROGNOSIS OF PEG-OPERATED PATIENT, AND COMPUTER RECORDING MEDIUM
DISPOSITIF POUR PRÉDIRE UN PRONOSTIC DE PATIENT POUR UNE OPÉRATION DE PEG, PROCÉDÉ POUR PRÉDIRE UN PRONOSTIC D'UN PATIENT POUR UNE OPÉRATION DE PEG, ET SUPPORT D'ENREGISTREMENT D'ORDINATEUR

abstract.p: A device for adequately predicting the prognosis of a PEG-operated patient to enable a doctor to judge whether or not to operate PEG (percutaneous endoscopic gasrostomy) to a patient. The device includes a prognosis prediction formula storage unit (14) for storing a prognosis prediction formula defined by applying a prediction input factor and a prediction output factor concerning a first PEG-operated patient to an ANN (artificial neural network) and a processing unit (16) for receiving a diagnosis input factor concerning a second patient and used to judge whether or not to operate PEG to the second patient, referencing the prognosis prediction formula stored in the prognosis prediction formula storage unit (14), calculating a diagnosis output factor corresponding to the diagnosis input factor, and outputting the calculated diagnosis output factor.

L'invention porte sur un dispositif pour prédire de façon adéquate le pronostic d'un patient pour une opération de PEG pour permettre à un médecin de déterminer s'il faut ou non réaliser la PEG (gastrotomie endoscopique percutanée) sur un patient. Le dispositif comprend une unité de mémorisation de formule de prédiction de pronostic (14) pour mémoriser une formule de prédiction de pronostic définie par l'application d'un facteur d'entrée de prédiction et d'un facteur de sortie de prédiction concernant un premier patient ayant subi une opération de PEG sur un ANN (réseau neural artificiel) et une unité de traitement (16) pour recevoir un facteur d'entrée de diagnostic concernant un second patient et utilisée pour déterminer s'il faut ou non réaliser une opération de PEG sur le second patient,

référencer la formule de prédiction de pronostic mémorisée dans l'unité de mémorisation de formule de prédiction de pronostic (14), calculer un facteur de sortie de diagnostic correspondant au facteur d'entrée de diagnostic, et émettre le facteur de sortie de diagnostic calculé.
